reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?
reply.analysis: The Privacy Policy clearly states that the app collects various forms of personal information for the purpose of providing services and enhancing user experience.
reply.reference: Our primary purpose for collecting personal information is to provide you with a secure, smooth, efficient, and effectively personalized service and user experience. URL: https://www.theaqapp.com/privacy

The purpose of this policy is to ensure that Mindwell provides you notice of our data collection and use policies. Capitalized terms not defined in this Privacy Policy shall have the meaning set forth in the Terms of Service.

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects personal information such as first and last name, gender, date of birth, height, weight, mental fitness and mindfulness goals, focus, breathing, heart rate, sleep, health and fitness activities, health condition, and nutritional info and practices.

reply.analysis: The answer is derived by extracting a list of personal data types mentioned in the privacy policy where the app declares the collection of data.
reply.reference: First and last name, gender, date of birth, height, weight, mental fitness and mindfulness goals, focus, breathing, heart rate, sleep, health and fitness activities, health condition, and nutritional info and practices. URL: https://www.theaqapp.com/privacy

AND HOW WE RESPOND TO DO NOT TRACK SIGNALS
Online tracking is the collection of data about an individual’s Internet activity used to deliver targeted advertisements and for other purposes. Some web browsers (including Safari, Internet Explorer, Firefox, and Chrome) incorporate a “Do Not Track” (DNT) or similar feature that signals to websites that a visitor does not want to have his/her online activity and behaviour tracked. If an online service elects to respond to a particular DNT signal, the ...

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that the app may share Personal Information with third-party services such as Apple, Amazon, and Mixpanel for various purposes, including providing health or fitness services, analytics purposes, and showcasing the performance of the Services.
reply.reference: We may share your Personal Information with the following third-party services: Apple and Amazon. We also share your Personal Information with Mixpanel, for analytics purposes. URL: https://www.theaqapp.com/privacy
